alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 11:55AM EDT until May 26 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT/2 PM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Franklin. In Panhandle Florida, Gulf. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT /200 PM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1153 AM EDT /1053 AM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port St. Joe, Ward Ridge, Jones Homestead, Milltown, Simmons Bayou, Highland View, Odena, Indian Pass, Thirteen Mile, Eleven Mile, Saint Joe Beach, St Joseph State Park, Nine Mile, Cape San Blas and Beacon Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
